intro: Albertokuntzea foliosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed habitats. Its fibrous roots and dense foliage make it an important component of the ecosystem in its native range.
